before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"6253d","text":"Make sure all salts and equipment to be used are available in the right quantities and functional respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f9pkq","text":"Phosphate buffered Saline ( PBS) is a buffer solution commonly used in biological research. It is a salty solution containing sodium chloride, sodium phosphate, and (in some formulations) potassium chloride and potassium phosphate. The buffer helps to maintain a constant pH. This SOP gives one of the most common formulations used in preparing PBS (1x PBS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6so4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4sgo","text":"137 mM NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fvkf","text":"10 mM Na2HPO4","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q9oj","text":"1.8 mM KH2PO4 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clps3","text":"pH 7.2 -7.4","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqot4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81jkc","text":"PBS can be used as a diluent in methods to dry biomolecules, as water molecules within it will be structured around the substance (protein, for example) to be ‘dried’ and immobilized to a solid surface. It is applied in washing cells after protein expression procedures due to its osmolarity and pH to avoid cell disruption to preserve and subsequently freeze the cells for downstream molecular biology applications. \n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b26u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3b8b5","text":"This protocol can be performed by anyone with basic lab skills","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8teku","text":"Before beginning the procedure, put on Personal Protective Equipment (Lab Gown, Gloves, shoes, masks and goggles).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckuj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lg7e","text":"Clean up work surfaces and environment using disinfection solution (Bleach and after 70% alcohol).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en866","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19el5","text":"Ensure that all reagents and equipment needed for the procedure are available, in place and functional.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uism","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82kf1","text":"Preparing 1 M NaOH","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0huk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67eag","text":"Weigh 19.95 g of NaOH pellets \u0026 dissolve them in half liter (500 mL) of distilled water water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frfro","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74i2h","text":"Preparing 3 M HCL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27bev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g1s4","text":"Measure out 8.5 mL of distilled water into a cleaned and dried 50 mL volumetric flask. Add 2.5 mL of Concentrated HCL.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7uk3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fo5h5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5d8td","text":"Remember to add acid to water, the volumetric flask should be part filled with water before adding the acid.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jhus","text":"Check the pH of the solution and either add 1M  or 3 M  gradually to adjust the to  or  as desired.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":54,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":83,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":87,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvb1q","text":"After confirming the pH, measure out the appropriate amount of sterile distilled water to make up the volume of the solution to 500 mL of 1x PBS.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"136de","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":825971,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Sodium hydroxide","linfor":"","url":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigald/795429?lang=en\u0026region=US\u0026cm_sp=Insite-_-caSrpResults_srpRecs_srpModel_795429-_-srpRecs3-1","sku":"795429","cas_number":"1310-73-2","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"12E025F0EBF411ECB2B109AE9B40205E","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":1,"name":"Contributed by users","link":"https://www.protocols.io","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/1.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/1.png"}}}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":955801,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Hydrochloric acid","linfor":"","url":"","sku":"","cas_number":"7647-01-0","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"352BC010EBF411ECB2B109AE9B40205E","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":31,"name":"Fisher Scientific","link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}},"2":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BC95CB00D11311ECB598419834C05482","id":0,"number":"7.2"}},"3":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C93573B0D11311ECB598419834C05482","id":0,"number":"7.4"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cu10","text":"Transfer the contents of the beaker into a 1000 mL Duran bottle and autoclave to make the PBS solution sterile. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6t9ud","text":"Remove the 1x PBS from the autoclave, allow it to cool, cork tightly and store at   or in the refrigerator and store at  . The 1x PBS buffer is ready for use in any molecular biology technique.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":120,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2ooe2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"951DCA60D06311ECA1C6CB998CD391C5","id":"50268","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"23","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8E5E57D0D06311ECA1C6CB998CD391C5","id":"50269","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"dairt","text":"Always put on the right Personal Protective Equipment to minimize or eliminate chances of accidental spill or splashes on the body or in the eye.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64krj","text":"Special caution should be taken while handling HCL because it it corrosive","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
